title: Duff and Phelps misses out in bidding war for KPMG's pension advice arm
text:
An adviser in the bankruptcy of Lehman Brothers and the liquidation of Bernie Madoff's assets has missed out on a deal to buy KPMG's pensions arm after the audit firm entered exclusive talks with a rival bidder.

KPMG confirmed that it was in advanced negotiations with UK buyout group Exponent on Wednesday morning, but said that a sale is not guaranteed.

Duff & Phelps is understood to have been among the bidders that had tabled second stage offers for the pensions advisory business, City sources said.
